cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 210 miles SE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest toward the northern Yucatan today, then across the southern Gulf of Mexico Tuesday, curving north-northeast toward the northern Gulf Coast (LA-MS area) Wednesday and accelerating inland across AL-GA toward the Mid-Atlantic Thursday

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane and tropical-storm watches/warnings limited to the Yucatan Peninsula; none issued for U.S. East Coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Tulum to Dzilam, Mexico; Tropical-Storm Warning western Cuba and portions of Yucatan
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Yucatan Peninsula today, then northern Gulf Coast from Louisiana to Alabama Wednesday; inland track across AL-GA-Carolinas into Mid-Atlantic
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusts below tropical-storm force (generally < 35 mph) late Thursday
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of moderate to locally heavy rain (2-3 inches) Thursday with localized ponding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Low, but non-zero risk of brief tornadoes in rainbands as the remnant center passes inland
